news_header: One fifth of the consortium developing European AI is Finnish, aiming to enhance competitiveness through collaboration among 20 technology companies and research institutes.
news_original_title: Eurooppa kehittää omaa teko­älyvalmiutta – suurhankkeessa vahva suomalais­edustus
news_text: The consortium established to develop European artificial intelligence comprises 20 members, with one fifth being Finnish. This collaboration includes European AI companies and research institutes, aiming to enhance the continent's competitiveness. The EU's OpenEuroLLM project focuses on creating high-performance, multilingual large language models (LLMs). Coordinated by Jan Hajic from the Czech Republic and Finnish entrepreneur Peter Sarlin, the project involves leading research institutes and companies. It aims to establish open-source AI models that democratize access to technology and strengthen European competitiveness in global markets, amidst concerns about AI innovation concentration outside the EU.
